docs.text:
Education




B.S. Chemical Engineering, Penn State 1996
. Total transformation in 4.5 years. 




Experience




(09/2016 - 06/2017) McCrossin - Bellefonte, PA 


(07/2010 - 09/2016) Center For Craniofacial and Dental Genetics - Pittsburgh, PA 


(01/2006 - 07/2010) University of Wisconsin Botany - Madison, WI 


(08/2004 - 06/2005) Penn State Computer Science and Engineering - State College, PA 


(04/2001 - 07/2003) University of Wisconsin Family Medicine - Madison, WI 


(01/1998 - 04/2000) Information Management Consultants, Inc. - McLean, VA 


(12/1996 - 07/1997) Ye Olde College Diner - State College, PA




Certificates


Enrolled in and completed these eight online 
edX Platform
 courses during 2015 and 2016.  The R programming, statistics and biology courses were presented by 
Rafael Irizarry, Professor of Biostatistics, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
.  Super-Earths and Life was presented by 
Dimitar Sasselov, Professor of Astronomy, Harvard University
.  The biostatistics courses are based on this book, available free: 
Data Analysis for the Life Sciences, Rafael A Irizarry and Michael I Love
 and also here on github: 
github.com/genomicsclass
.  I completed six of these courses on time and with scores high enough to earn a certificate.  For two classes, ChIP-seq data analysis and DNA methylation data analysis, scores were too low to earn a certificate.  Detailed performance information are shown below for all completed courses.  






PH525.1x: Statistics and R for the Life Sciences 
pdf
 
png






PH525.2x: Introduction to Linear Models and Matrix Algebra 
pdf
 
png






PH525.4x: Introduction to Bioconductor 
pdf
 
png






PH525.5x Case Study: RNA-seq data analysis 
pdf
 
png






PH525.6x Case Study: Variant Discovery and Genotyping 
pdf
 
png






PH525.7x Case Study: ChIP-seq data analysis 
pdf
 
png






PH525.8x Case study: DNA methylation data analysis 
pdf
 
png






SPU30x: Super-Earths and Life 
pdf
 
png






Programming


C






Deadtapes iPhone App
 is available on the Apple App Store: 
https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/deadtapes/id838487529?mt=8






Nuclides iPhone App
  Nuclides was constructed using Objective-C in xCode using iOS7 in February 2014.  This application behaves very similarly to the Nuclides Android app available on Google Play.  The Nuclides iPhone App is not available on the Apple App Store.  
(code on github)






Java






Many android apps 
https://play.google.com/store/apps/developer?id=Thomas+Maher






Herbjava tomcat servlet application
.  When running, The Wisconsin Herbarium java port will perform very similarly to the existing perl, python and off-the-shelf web servers running in three other places: 
http://www.botany.wisc.edu/wisflora/
, 
http://wisconsinherbarium.appspot.com/
, 
http://herbarium.wisc.edu/
,  
(code on github)






Javascript






Awesomplete javascript autocompletion with 28510 gene symbols
.  This short web form 
http://li1077-179.members.linode.com/gene.html
 selects and displays candidate gene symbols that you start typing with auto-completion.  It selects candidate gene symbols from a long list of 28510 genes (gathered from UCSC's knownCanonical table in 2016) and uses Lea Verou's excellent Awesomplete library.   
(code on github)






UCSC Genome Browser dynamic custom track documentation
.  Adding dynamic javascript to a UCSC genome browser custom track documentation file is possible.  
(code on github)






Agemaker age calculating offline web app
.  
http://li1077-179.members.linode.com/agemaker.html
 The application logic is written in Javascript and uses the entered birthdate to calculate the current age to one decimal place (for data entry).  This application is an offline web app which means that it will continue to work even after your Internet connection dies (on all modern browers).  The javascript, HTML5 and everything is in one file, agemaker.html:  
(code on github)






Perl




Wisconsin Herbarium on Perl
.  
http://www.botany.wisc.edu/wisflora/
,  
(code on github)




Php






Laravelcarriers
.  Simple writable database program runnning on Laravel php web framework.  
(code on github)






Zipper
.  zipper.php is a php program that creates zip archives.  Requires ZipArchive class be available: http://www.php.net/manual/en/class.ziparchive.php  
(code on github)






Phpuploader
.  PHP script to upload files to web server.  
(code on github)






Python






Google App Engine
: Each of the GAE apps are written in python






http://wisconsinherbarium.appspot.com/






http://fixamfm.appspot.com/






http://fixwdc.appspot.com/










Albumartmaker
.  Creates new 300x300 PNG file in the current directory: test.png.  Requires modules Image, ImageDraw, and texwrap.  Will use ImageFont if you have them (/usr/share/fonts/bitstream-vera/Vera.ttf) 
(code on github)






Searchyumrepos
.  Search yum software repositories for your list of software. 
(code on github)






Gmailer
.  Short python script to use gmail to send email, 
(code on github)






Ucscdiskspacer
.  Program to report total size, in bytes, of UCSC genome browser databases, 
(code on github)
.  Run like this to learn the size of the total size of a zebrafish and human genome download 
python ucsc_disk_spacer.py danRer5 hg19






Ucscquery
.  Python standalone program to query UCSC Genome Browser Mysql database, requires module MySQLdb, requires internet access, 
(code on github)
.  This program performs steps that can be run manually with a mysql client:






mysql --user=genome --host=genome-mysql.cse.ucsc.edu -A
mysql> use mm9;
Database changed
mysql> select * from knownCanonical;








Botitwebmaker
.  Python program that generates HTML web site from a directory of image files.  Generated the HTML found here: 
http://botit.botany.wisc.edu/
,  
(code on github)






QRCode
.  
(code on github)
, see 
Ruby
 section for details.






R






R programming certificates
.  See 
certificates earned
 section. 






R package Rufosightings
.  Provides UFO sightings data as an R dataframe and simple functions.  Use R to install and run it like this: 






library(devtools)
install_github("botanyhelp/Rufosightings")
library(Rufosightings)
ufo_byexactdate()
ufo_byexactdate(20100704)
dim(Rufosightings)
Rufosightings[Rufosightings$sighted_at_year=="1950",]
Rufosightings[Rufosightings$sighted_at_year=="1942",]$description
Rufosightings[Rufosightings$sighted_at_year=="1942",]$duration
Rufosightings[Rufosightings$sighted_at_year=="1942",]$shape
levels(Rufosightings$shape)
Rufosightings[Rufosightings$location_city==" Slickville",]
library(dplyr)
glimpse(Rufosightings)
select(Rufosightings,c(location_city,shape,description)) %>% filter(location_city==" Miami") %>% filter(shape==" cigar")






R package Remdat
.  Provides 
www.emdat.be
 disasters data as an R dataframe.  Use R to install and run it like this: 




library(devtools)
install_github("botanyhelp/Remdata")
library(Remdat)
head(Remdat)








R Shiny Web Application
.  Uses the Remdat package for data to explore in the web application. 




Disasters Worldwide Shiny App http://li1077-179.members.linode.com:8787/)








Ruby






Herokucarriers
.  Be patient: heroku dymo startup takes a few second: 
https://aqueous-bayou-3129.herokuapp.com/carriers/
,  
(code on github)






QRCode
.  This ruby code creates png formatted images of the QR codes. It 
also
 dumps text which can be used to create an HTML/CSS version of the QR code.  After running the ruby program 
with the included example data
, six new 300x300 PNG-formatted images will be created in the current directory. The output HTML from the python can be dropped right into any HTML file and will display the QR codes as HTML.  The workflow requires python and the ruby requires some modules that are probably not present.  Install them with gem like this and run the whole thing like this:






gem install rqrcode
gem install rqrcode_png
ruby qrHTMLandPNGmaker.rb >> rb.txt
python qrHTMLmaker.py >> qr_codes.html




Web Content






Multilingual and right to left HTML5
.  Displays the hebrew language and instructs the browser to present it using a right-to-left reading orientation which is proper for right to left languages like hebrew.  Notice in your browser that it 
selects
 the text using the 
right to left
 orientation. 
http://li1077-179.members.linode.com/hebrew.html
,  
(code on github)






Two languages on one page
.  One page of HTML, two languages: 
http://li1077-179.members.linode.com/russian.html
,  
(code on github)






Offline web application
, Agemaker age calculating web page. This web application is an 
offline web app
 such that, when you revisit this URL later, 
when you have no Internet connection
, it still works (on all modern web browsers). 
http://li1077-179.members.linode.com/agemaker.html
,  
(code on github)






Cloud






Google App Engine 
. Three python web applications on Google App Engine infrastructure:




Wisconsin Herbarium
  
(code on github)


Fix AM FM
  
(code on github)


Fix WDC








Heroku
.  Ruby on Rails web application running on Heroku, 
(be patient for the five second dymo startup)
:  
Aircraft Carriers
,  
(code on github)






Databases






Google Data Store
. These three App Engine web apps use the Google Data Store for persistence:






http://fixwdc.appspot.com/






http://fixamfm.appspot.com/
  
(code on github)






http://wisconsinherbarium.appspot.com/
  
(code on github)










Postgres
.  Rails applications running on the free tier at Heroku are required to use Postgres database, as does 
Aircraft Carriers
,  
(code on github)






MySQL
. 
Wisconsin Herbarium






Sqlite
.  A custom sqlite database is at the heart of over half of the android apps on this page
